entry.value: Firstly, this component creates a table where values are assigned to single time points that have been extracted from a time range. For example, a table where each row corresponds to a contract value and a contract period can be converted to a table where each row corresponds to a month and the contract value for this month. The granularity of the time points that are extracted from the time ranges can be set to "Days" or "Months". The higher the granularity, the more single time points are extracted from each time range.%%00010%%00010Secondly, this component shows the development of ARR, MRR and/or Customer count by cohort and time.%%00010%%00010A cohort for each ID is defined as follows: The time point is extracted when the ID occurs in the data for the first time. Next, the ID is assigned to the cohort that is the closes to this time point. The available cohorts depend on the selected granularity. %%00010%%00010The output of the component shows%%000101. The development of the selected measure(s) by time and cohort in a stacked area chart%%000102. The contribution of each cohort to the selected measure(s) over time in a line plot%%000103. The values that are split to the single time points within the given time range%%00010%%00010The cohort charts can be built separately to max. two groups in the data, for example, according to the label of customers as "old" and "new". For better performance, only the first 2500 rows are displayed in the cohort charts.

The required input is a numeric column containing values that are split to the single time points and that are aggregated by the selected measure(s), two columns of type Date&Time that define the start and end point of the time range, and a String or numeric column that contains IDs that identify the values assigned to the time periods. A String column with max. 2 unique values can be used to visualize the measures separately for these groups.
Outer workflow does not have input data, execute it first
